header.title: About DofusGroup
header.lead: DofusGroup is a community platform for creating events around activities in the MMORPG Dofus, allowing players to easily organize themselves into groups.

content.text: The application allows users, once their account is created, to create events to find players who want to join them.
Each user can add multiple characters in their profile (representing their in-game avatars) and register them for events available on the platform.
A comment system attached to each event allows participants to communicate with each other.
Currently, there is no efficient tool addressing this specific need: planning gaming sessions in advance and organizing groups clearly.

DofusGroup is not designed to instantly find a group, but rather to provide a way to schedule an activity at a given date and time, register in advance, and form a stable group before the gaming session.
The platform is mainly intended for:

items: Single-account players dependent on other players to progress.
Guilds wishing to schedule sessions among their members.

content.text: Events can be made private: they are then accessible only via the event's URL.
The main benefit for the user is better organization and optimization of gaming sessions, without relying on the game's recruitment channel, which is often hard to read.

I am a career-changing developer and started developing DofusGroup alongside my training. My experience is web-oriented. Much of my learning is self-taught, which allows me to be technically curious and learn new tools quickly.

I chose Dofus as a starting point because I have been passionate about this universe for nearly 20 years. The project continues the tradition of fan-sites and community tools developed by players over the years.
What I enjoy most in development: turning a concrete need into a technical solution, working on ergonomics and design, and seeing a project take shape over time.

DofusGroup was born from a mix of passion, learning, and the desire to share. It is a project designed for players, but also highlights my approach as a developer: creating concrete, useful, and accessible tools to improve the user experience.
